meanings.definition: Using power or authority in an arrogant or overbearing manner.
meanings.sent1: The highhanded manager made decisions without listening to anyone else.
meanings.sent2: Her highhanded behavior alienated her coworkers.
meanings.sent3: The highhanded principal declared a ban on all snacks in the school.
meanings.sent4: His highhanded approach to leadership left everyone feeling powerless.
meanings.sent5: The highhanded ruler ruled with an iron fist, crushing any opposition.

meanings.definition: Done without consideration for others; dictatorial.
meanings.sent1: The highhanded dictator imposed strict rules on the citizens.
meanings.sent2: She had a highhanded way of enforcing her decisions.
meanings.sent3: The highhanded chef refused to take any special requests from customers.
meanings.sent4: His highhanded attitude towards teamwork stifled creativity in the group.
meanings.sent5: The highhanded judge handed down harsh sentences without mercy.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a lack of regard for the feelings or opinions of others.
meanings.sent1: Her highhanded remarks hurt the feelings of those around her.
meanings.sent2: The highhanded politician ignored the concerns of the community.
meanings.sent3: The highhanded student always interrupted others during class discussions.
meanings.sent4: His highhanded behavior made it difficult for others to approach him.
meanings.sent5: The highhanded boss dismissed all feedback from the employees.
